Quizlet:
*better*
adjective: best, better, lead
adverb: best, better

"Mejor vamos a la playa." Translation: "Let's go to the beach instead."

*are*
verb: be, stay, stand

"Ellos están en el parque." - They are in the park.

*goes*
verb: go, be, head

"Va a la escuela." - He/She is going to school.

*man*
noun: man, husband, love
phrase: old bean

"El hombre es inteligente." - The man is intelligent.

*you*
pronoun: you

Usted es una persona muy inteligente.
You are a very intelligent person.

*a lot*
adverb: much, lot, a lot
noun: much

Mucho gusto, mi nombre es Juan. - Nice to meet you, my name is Juan.

*does*
adjective: ago
adverb: ago

Hace un año que no nos vemos. - It has been a year since we last saw each other.

*so*
adverb: then, now, at that time

Entonces, decidimos ir al cine. - Then, we decided to go to the movies.

*I feel*
verb: feel, sense, regret

"Siento mucho haber llegado tarde." - I'm sorry for arriving late.

*have*
verb: have, keep, own

Tenemos mucho trabajo que hacer. - We have a lot of work to do.

*can*
verb: be able to, can, may

Puedes ir al cine esta noche. - You can go to the movies tonight.

*there*
adverb: there

"Ahí está mi casa." - There is my house.

*you*
pronoun: you, thee

"Tiene una casa muy bonita." - She has a very pretty house.

*life*
noun: life, living, lifetime

"La vida es un regalo precioso." - Life is a precious gift.

*see*
verb: see, view, watch

"Yo veo una película." - I see a movie.

*someone*
pronoun: someone, anyone, somebody

Alguien me ayudará con esto. - Someone will help me with this.

*Mr*
abbreviation: Mr.

"Sr. Smith, ¿puedo ayudarle?" - Mr. Smith, can I help you?

*until*
preposition: to, until, till
adverb: up, even, through

"Hasta luego!" - See you later!

*without*
preposition: without, out of, minus
suffix: less
adverb: except

"Vivir sin amor es como una vida vacía." - Living without love is like an empty life.

*my*
pronoun: me, to me

"Yo quiero a mí mismo." - "I love myself."

*only*
adjective: single, alone, one
noun: solo

Solo quiero estar contigo. - I only want to be with you.

*years*
pronoun: us

"Tengo veinte años." - I am twenty years old.

*about*
preposition: on, about, upon
noun: envelope, packet

"Él escribió un ensayo sobre la historia de la ciencia." - He wrote an essay about the history of science.

*say*
verb: say, tell, speak
noun: saying

"Él dijo que no podía decir la verdad." - He said he couldn't tell the truth.

*one*
adjective: one
: one
pronoun: one, you
prefix: uni-

"Uno es un número." - One is a number.

*always*
adverb: always, ever, forever

"Siempre estoy aquí para ayudar." - I'm always here to help.

*oh*
interjection: Ooh!

Oh, qué lindo! - Oh, how lovely!

*go*
verb: go, be, head

Él fue a la playa. He went to the beach.

*things*
noun: stuff, belongings

"Tengo muchas cosas que hacer hoy." - I have a lot of things to do today.

*also*
adverb: also, too, as well

"También me gusta leer libros." - I also like to read books.

*before*
adverb: before, above, previously

Antes de salir, me aseguré de cerrar la puerta. Before leaving, I made sure to close the door.

*have you*
verb: have

Él ha comido. - He has eaten.

*neither*
conjunction: or, nor, neither
adverb: neither

"Ni una sola palabra." - Not a single word.

*my*


Mis padres son muy amables. - My parents are very kind.

*day*
noun: day
abbreviation: d.

"Hoy es un día hermoso." - Today is a beautiful day.

*be*
verb: be, stay, stand

"Ella está cansada." - She is tired.

*we are*
verb: be, stay, stand

Estamos aprendiendo español. - We are learning Spanish.

*evening*
noun: night, nighttime, love

"Anoche fue una noche muy divertida." - Last night was a very fun night.

*nobody*
pronoun: nobody, no one, anyone

Nadie sabe la verdad. - Nobody knows the truth.

*other*
interjection: Encore!

"Quiero otra cerveza, por favor." - "I want another beer, please."

*wants*
verb: want, love, wish

"Él quiere ir al parque." - He wants to go to the park.

*seems*
verb: seem, appear, look like

Parece que va a llover, It looks like it's going to rain.

*us*
pronoun: us, we

Nosotros somos amigos. We are friends.

*bit*
adjective: little, short, shallow
adverb: little, few, thin
noun: little, bit

"No tengo mucho tiempo, así que solo podemos hablar un poco." - I don't have much time, so we can only talk

*father*
noun: father, parent, sire
abbreviation: f.

"Mi padre es mi mejor amigo." - My father is my best friend.

*job*
noun: work, job, labor

"El trabajo es muy importante para mí." - Work is very important to me.

*people*
noun: people, folk, town

"La gente está empezando a salir." - People are starting to go out.

*look*
noun: sight, intention, watchtower

Mira, allí está mi casa. - Look, there is my house.

*you go*
verb: go, be, head

"Vas a la escuela?" - Are you going to school?

*be*
verb: be, come, come of

La ciudad está cerca del mar, el cual es un gran mar. - The city is close to the sea, which is a great sea.

*them*
pronoun: them

Les presento mis saludos. - I present my greetings to them.

*where*
adverb: where, wherein, as
conjunction: where

"¿Dónde está el banco?" - Where is the bank?

*same*
adjective: same, very, one

"Aprendí el mismo año que mi hermano." - I learned the same year as my brother.

*made*
noun: fact, deed, factor
adjective: complete, taken, mature

"Él ha hecho muchas cosas buenas." - He has done many good things.

*they*
pronoun: them, they

Ellos comieron mucho. - They ate a lot.

*said*
verb: say, tell, speak

"Él dijo que iba a ir a la tienda", He said he was going to the store.

*happens*
noun: pass, raisin

"¿Qué pasa?" - What's up?

*money*
noun: money

"Tengo que ahorrar dinero para mi viaje." - I have to save money for my trip.

*son*
noun: son, child, sonny

"Mi hijo es el amor de mi vida." - My son is the love of my life.

*such*
adjective: such, suchlike

Tal vez mañana salgamos al parque. - Maybe we'll go to the park tomorrow.

*other*
adjective: other, another, another one
pronoun: other, another

"Ella quiere otro pastel." - She wants another cake.

*talk*
verb: talk, speak, chat

"Ella siempre habla con sus amigos." - She always talks to her friends.

*sure*
adjective: sure, safe, secure
noun: insurance, assurance, tumbler
adverb: definitely, in the bag

"Seguro que sí." - Sure (of it).

*clear*
adjective: clear, light, plain
noun: clearing, glade, gap

"Claro que sí" - Of course yes.

*are*
adjective: these
pronoun: these

Estas enamorado? - Are you in love?

*place*
noun: place, site, spot

"Este lugar es hermoso." - This place is beautiful.

*world*
noun: world, savoir faire

"El mundo es un lugar muy grande." - The world is a very big place.

*friend*
noun: friend, buddy, chum
adjective: friendly

"Tú eres mi mejor amigo." - You are my best friend.

*wait*
noun: wait, waiting, delay

Espero que llegues pronto. - I hope you arrive soon.

*shit*
noun: shit, crap, bullshit

"Esta mierda es muy difícil de limpiar." - This shit is very hard to clean.

*they have*
verb: have

Han pasado dos años desde que nos mudamos. - It has been two years since we moved.

*your*
pronoun: your, thine

"Tus amigos son los mejores." - "Your friends are the best."

*knows*
verb: know, realize, taste

"¿Él sabe cómo llegar a la estación?" - Does he know how to get to the station?

*after*
adverb: after, then, later

Después nos iremos a casa. Afterward, we will go home.

*moment*
noun: time, moment, point
abbreviation: MO

El momento es ahora. The moment is now.

*from*
preposition: from, since, from the

Desde hace mucho tiempo, he estado esperando esto.
Translation: I've been waiting for this for a long time.

*out*
adverb: outside, out, away

"Fuera de aquí!" - Get out of here!

*stuff*
noun: thing, matter, object

"¿Qué cosa es eso?" - What is that thing?

*guy*
noun: type, kind, sort

"Él es un tipo muy divertido." - He is a really funny guy.

*tomorrow*
adjective: morning
noun: morning, tomorrow
adverb: tomorrow

Mañana nos vemos en la playa. - We will see each other at the beach tomorrow.

*can*
verb: be able to, can, may

Podemos aprender un nuevo idioma juntos. We can learn a new language together.

*said*
noun: pendant, trinket

Dije que me gustaría ir al cine. - I said that I would like to go to the movies.

*great*
adjective: great, large, big

"Es un gran honor para mí." - It is a great honor for me.

*need*


Necesito un lápiz. 
I need a pencil.

*state*
noun: state, status, condition

"El estado de la economía es difícil de predecir." - The state of the economy is difficult to predict.

*could*
auxiliary verb: could

Podría ir al parque mañana. - I could go to the park tomorrow.

*agreement*
noun: agreement, accordance, deal

"Estamos de acuerdo con tus sugerencias." - We agree with your suggestions.

*dad*
noun: dad, daddy, papa

"Papá siempre me lleva a la escuela en la mañana." - Dad always takes me to school in the morning.

*have*
verb: have, keep, own

Tengo un hermano mayor. I have an older brother.

*says*
verb: say, tell, speak

"Dice que está cansado." - He says he is tired.

*mine*
pronoun: mine

"Este libro es mío." - "This book is mine."

*do you think*
verb: create, make, set up

"¿Crees que tengo razón?" - Do you think I'm right?

*good*
adjective: good, nice, kind

Ella es una buena persona. - She is a good person.

*like*
verb: like, taste, love

Me gusta la música clásica. I like classical music.

*our*
pronoun: our

Nuestro hogar es un refugio para nosotros. - Our home is a refuge for us.

*new*
adjective: new, fresh, further

"Tengo un nuevo coche." - "I have a new car."

*be*


"Será mejor que salgamos temprano." - It will be better if we leave early.

*doing*
verb: do, make, ask

"Estoy haciendo mi tarea" - I am doing my homework.

*days*
noun: day

Los días pasan muy rápido. - The days pass by quickly.

*name*
noun: name, noun, forename

Mi nombre es Ana. - My name is Ana.
